name: crisprseq-targeted
description: Advanced bioinformatics pipeline for analyzing CRISPR-edited data from next-generation sequencing experiments. Supports targeted analysis for gene editing quality evaluation and screening analysis for gene discovery from CRISPR screens.
content:
Introduction

nf-core/crisprseq is an advanced bioinformatics pipeline for comprehensive analysis of CRISPR-edited genomic data from next-generation sequencing experiments. Developed by researchers at Universitat Pompeu Fabra and Universität Tübingen, it provides robust, reproducible workflows for CRISPR data analysis.

Analysis Modes

Targeted Analysis: Evaluates gene editing experiment quality using targeted NGS data. The workflow includes read merging, quality control, adapter trimming, optional UMI clustering, read mapping, and edit calling for gene knockouts, knock-ins, base editing, and prime editing experiments.

Screening Analysis: Discovers important genes from CRISPR knockout or activation screens using pooled DNA. Includes read quality control, mapping, optional CNV correction, and sgRNA/gene ranking.

Pipeline Outputs

Targeted Analysis Outputs: Quality control reports, processed reads, alignment files, edit calling results, and comprehensive summary statistics for evaluating CRISPR editing efficiency and specificity.

Screening Analysis Outputs: sgRNA counts, gene-level analysis, ranking tables for identifying significant hits, and quality control metrics for pooled screen validation.

The pipeline is built using Nextflow with modular design, containerized processes, and automated continuous integration testing for maximum reproducibility and reliability.
command: export NXF_CACHE_DIR=/camber_work/temp/.nextflow; export NXF_LOG_FILE=/home/camber/jobs/${JOB_ID}/outputs/nextflow.log; nextflow run nf-core/crisprseq -r 2.3.0 --input ${samplesheet_location} --analysis ${analysis_type} --outdir ${outdir} --max_memory 3.GB --max_cpus 2 -c /etc/mpi/nextflow.camber.config -ansi-log false -profile k8s

spec.description: Path to CSV file containing sample information with sample names and FASTQ file paths. Must end in .csv format.

spec.name: analysis_type
spec.description: Type of CRISPR analysis to perform: 'targeted' for gene editing quality evaluation or 'screening' for gene discovery from CRISPR screens

spec.description: Output directory for analysis results. If not specified, results will be written to ~/jobs/<jobid>/outputs/
